title: Anthony Ko
text: I am a senior at UCLA, pursuing a degree in Statistics and Data Science, with a strong passion for applying data-driven solutions to real-world problems. Throughout my academic journey, I have developed a solid foundation in statistical modeling, machine learning, and data analysis, alongside practical experience with programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL. I am particularly interested in leveraging data to drive decision-making in the tech industry, with aspirations to contribute to areas like artificial intelligence, data engineering, or business intelligence.

title: Projects
text: This project involves building a recommendation system to provide personalized product suggestions for Amazon customers based on their previous ratings. Leveraging a dataset of Amazon product reviews, the system aims to enhance user experience by delivering relevant recommendations while supporting business goals through improved customer engagement.

title: Projects
text:
FoodHub Order Analysis
This project involves analyzing the data to get a fair idea about the demand of different restaurants which will help the company to enhance business and customer experience. Performed Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) on a FoodHub dataset to determine correlations and characteristics. Utilized Seaborn and MatPlotLib to visualize food preparation time, cost of orders, and delivery times. Mutated the set for restaurants fulfilling rating count and score for promotional offers.
